text: Richard Jenkins, FAcSS (born 1952) is a sociologist and retired academic. From 1995 to 2014, he was Chair in Sociology at the University of Sheffield. == Life == Richard Jenkins was born in 1952 in Liverpool and grew up in Northern Ireland. He studied social anthropology at Queen's University Belfast, and the University of Cambridge, where he completed his doctoral studies; his PhD was awarded in 1981 for his thesis "Young people, education and work in a Belfast housing estate". After working at the Social Science Research Council Unit on Ethnic Relations at Aston University, Jenkins took up a post at University College Swansea in 1983. He moved to the University of Sheffield in 1995 to take up the Chair in Sociology, which had been vacant since 1986. He retired in 2014 but remains at Sheffield as an emeritus professor. In 2004, he was elected to the Academy of Social Sciences."Emeritus Professor Richard Jenkins", University of Sheffield.
